H0.text: Dead organisms are the source from which most fungi obtain organic compounds.

H1.text: Inorganic material is what most fungi get organic compounds from.

H2.text: Living organisms are the source from which most fungi obtain organic compounds.

H3.text: Carnivorous organisms are the source from which most fungi obtain organic compounds.

A4.text: Fungi perform an essential role in the decomposition of organic matter

A5.text: Fungi can also act as mycoparasites or antagonists of other fungi, such as Hypomyces chrysospermus, which grows on bolete mushrooms

A6.text: Prime decomposers are bacteria or fungi, though larger scavengers also play an important role in decomposition if the body is accessible to insects, mites and other animals.

A7.text: For instance, lignin is a component of wood, which is relatively resistant to decomposition and can in fact only be decomposed by certain fungi, such as the white-rot fungi.
